issue.title: Unblock https://animevsub.ga
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] This site DOES NOT contains sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [X] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

AdGuard for Android

### AdGuard version

4.0.75

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Website or app doesn't work properly

### Which browser(s) do you use?

Chrome

### Which device do you use?

Mobile

### Where is the problem encountered?

https://app.animevsub.ml

### What filters do you have enabled?

AdGuard Base filter, AdGuard Mobile Ads filter, AdGuard Tracking Protection filter, AdGuard URL Tracking filter, AdGuard Annoyances filter, Filter unblocking search ads and self-promotion, KAD - Anti-Scam, Dandelion Sprout's Annoyances List, Legitimate URL Shortener

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

Hide your search queries, Send Do-Not-Track signals, Self-destruction of third-party cookies, Block WebRTC, Block Location API, Mask your IP address (specify in comment below, if used custom value), Remove X-Client-Data header from HTTP requests

### Add your comment and screenshots

1. This is an open source application download site to watch Anime online
Source code: https://github.com/anime-vsub/app
2. Screenshots
<details><summary>Screenshot 1:</summary>
![Screenshot_2022-11-02-21-51-20](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/45375496/199525114-c05b25fe-f288-453e-9cf3-58cbebbb0e0d.png)

<!-- paste screenshot here -->

</details>

### Privacy

- [X] I agree to follow this condition

comment.body:
> > I could've sworn that the domain led to what seemed to be a Vietnamese manga sub team's project page soon after Sergey told me to check it, but now I too seem unable to load the page.
> 
> Probably temporary outage. Still strange that there aren't any Google results for it & VT didn't even know it existed before today.

I think this is a DNS error i moved the domain to https://app.animevsub.ga please check again

pull_request.title: oshiete.goo.ne.jp
pull_request.body:
# Creating the pull request

> Please include a summary of the change and which issue is fixed\
> If the related issue does not exist in our repository, please create it before making pull request\
> It is highly recommended to use our [Web Reporting Tool](https://kb.adguard.com/en/technical-support/reporting-tool) instead of creating an issue on GitHub directly\

> Please include a summary of the change and which issue is fixed\
> If the related issue does not exist in our repository, please create it before making pull request\
> It is highly recommended to use our [Web Reporting Tool](https://kb.adguard.com/en/technical-support/reporting-tool) instead of creating an issue on GitHub directly\
> Please note, that we verify every pull request manually, so it may take time to apply it

## Prerequisites

### To avoid invalid pull requests, please check and confirm following terms

- [x] This is not an ad/bug report;
- [x] My code follows the [guidelines](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) and [syntax](https://kb.adguard.com/general/how-to-create-your-own-ad-filters) of this project;
- [x] I have performed a self-review of my own changes;
- [x] My changes do not break web sites, apps and files structure.

## What problem does the pull request fix?

### If the problem does not fall under any category that is listed here, please write a comment below in corresponding section

- [ ] Missed ads or ad leftovers;
- [ ] Website or app doesn't work properly;
- [ ] AdGuard gets detected on a website;
- [ ] Missed analytics or tracker;
- [ ] Social media buttons — share, like, tweet, etc;
- [ ] Annoyances — pop-ups, cookie warnings, etc;
- [ ] Filters maintenance.

## What issue is being fixed?
https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/133556
### Enter the issue address

Example: <https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/100000>

### Add your comment and screenshots

#### If possible, a screenshot of a page or application should not be cropped too much. Otherwise, it is not always clear where the element is located

0. **DO NOT** upload screenshots with sexually explicit material on GitHub directly.\
 Instead, upload it to a third-party image hosting and post the link to it without preview (!) here.\
 Also, mention if the link leads to NSFW content;

1. Add screenshots of the problem. You can drag and drop images or paste them from clipboard

    Use `<details> </details>` tag to hide screenshots under the spoiler;

2. Describe the issue in detail until it is absolutely clear from the screenshot what the problem is

    You can also indicate any other information that you think the developers should know.

**Warning:** Please remove personal information before uploading screenshots!

1. Your comment

<!-- Please write a comment here -->

2. Screenshots

<details>

<summary>Screenshot 1:</summary>

<!-- paste screenshot here -->

</details>

<details>

<summary>Screenshot N:</summary>

<!-- paste screenshot here -->

</details>

### Terms

- [x] By submitting this issue, I agree that pull request does not contain private info and all conditions are met

issue.body:

comment.body:
> Why do you add this rule as generic? It should be something like that and you need to add it to the specific.txt.
> 
> ```
> doujinhibiki.net##div[class^="unBox"][class*="ad"]
> ```

this rule is just a variation of the `.adbox` rule that is used a lot in Japanese websites. so i think instead of defining a website we should put it in generic

comment.body:
Why do you add this rule as generic?
It should be something like that and you need to add it to the specific.txt.
```
doujinhibiki.net##div[class^="unBox"][class*="ad"]
```

# Creating the pull request

> Please include a summary of the change and which issue is fixed\
> If the related issue does not exist in our repository, please create it before making pull request\
> It is highly recommended to use our [Web Reporting Tool](https://kb.adguard.com/en/technical-support/reporting-tool) instead of creating an issue on GitHub directly\
> Please note, that we verify every pull request manually, so it may take time to apply it

## Prerequisites

### To avoid invalid pull requests, please check and confirm following terms

- [x] This is not an ad/bug report;
- [x] My code follows the [guidelines](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) and [syntax](https://kb.adguard.com/general/how-to-create-your-own-ad-filters) of this project;
- [x] I have performed a self-review of my own changes;
- [x] My changes do not break web sites, apps and files structure.

## What problem does the pull request fix?

### If the problem does not fall under any category that is listed here, please write a comment below in corresponding section

- [ ] Missed ads or ad leftovers;
- [ ] Website or app doesn't work properly;
- [ ] AdGuard gets detected on a website;
- [ ] Missed analytics or tracker;
- [ ] Social media buttons — share, like, tweet, etc;
- [ ] Annoyances — pop-ups, cookie warnings, etc;
- [ ] Filters maintenance.

## What issue is being fixed?

### Enter the issue address
https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/133617

### Add your comment and screenshots

#### If possible, a screenshot of a page or application should not be cropped too much. Otherwise, it is not always clear where the element is located

0. **DO NOT** upload screenshots with sexually explicit material on GitHub directly.\
 Instead, upload it to a third-party image hosting and post the link to it without preview (!) here.\
 Also, mention if the link leads to NSFW content;

1. Add screenshots of the problem. You can drag and drop images or paste them from clipboard

    Use `<details> </details>` tag to hide screenshots under the spoiler;

2. Describe the issue in detail until it is absolutely clear from the screenshot what the problem is

    You can also indicate any other information that you think the developers should know.

**Warning:** Please remove personal information before uploading screenshots!

1. Your comment

<!-- Please write a comment here -->

2. Screenshots

<details>

<summary>Screenshot 1:</summary>

<!-- paste screenshot here -->

</details>

<details>

<summary>Screenshot N:</summary>

<!-- paste screenshot here -->

</details>

### Terms

- [x] By submitting this issue, I agree that pull request does not contain private info and all conditions are met

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Ads) [http://rezka.ag](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=http%3A%2F%2Frezka.ag) ### Comment > Смотрела было все ок, только сильно подвисало постоянно, на сайте прямым текстом написано, что если вы используете блокировщики рекламы, сайт будет виснуть. Мне это надоело, я решила полазить в настройках вашего приложения, вдруг найду что-то полезное. Наклацала непонятно что, вроде вернула все обратно, но теперь вылезла проблема - законные две рекламы вернулись к моим просмотрам сериалов и фильмов. При этом на самом сайте много всплывающих окон и баннеров, их по прежнему не видно. Что я наклацала не знаю, в самом сафари расширение включено, с настроек все включено, если в приложение зайти то там стоит защита сафари включена. А по факту лажа. Хелп, сама я не могу разобраться. ### Screenshots

https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/133615#issuecomment-1296243581 - It's probably caused by one of the third party filters, so please disable filter lists one by one and check which one causes this issue.

<hr>

pull_request.title: doujinhibiki.net
pull_request.body:
# Creating the pull request

> Please include a summary of the change and which issue is fixed\
> If the related issue does not exist in our repository, please create it before making pull request\
> It is highly recommended to use our [Web Reporting Tool](https://kb.adguard.com/en/technical-support/reporting-tool) instead of creating an issue on GitHub directly\
> Please note, that we verify every pull request manually, so it may take time to apply it

## Prerequisites

### To avoid invalid pull requests, please check and confirm following terms

- [x] This is not an ad/bug report;
- [x] My code follows the [guidelines](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) and [syntax](https://kb.adguard.com/general/how-to-create-your-own-ad-filters) of this project;
- [x] I have performed a self-review of my own changes;

labels.name: NSFW
labels.description: Nudes and porn sites

labels.name: Extra
labels.description: Issues, related to AdGuard Extra extension

labels.name: A: Problematic
labels.description: Issues, which cannot be resolved easily

issue.body:
This issue has been escalated to [AdGuard Extra](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdGuardExtra):
https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdGuardExtra/issues/371

Please wait until it is solved there.

If you’re using AdGuard for Windows, Mac or Android, you’re probably already using AdGuard Extra so you just need to wait until it is updated.

If you’re using AdGuard Browser Extension, we suggest installing AdGuard Extra in addition to it.

* [Install for Chrome, Edge or other Chromium-based browsers](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_chrome_release)
* [Install for Firefox](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_firefox_release)

comment.body:
Hi @BlazDT _(and @zloyden)_,   ﹥Similar to https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/131213#issuecomment-1266935078   Regarding [your commit](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/commit/e0ff057211c4569b0fafd77303ee360c5b25f0e7), this rule is already presents [here](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/e0ff057211c4569b0fafd77303ee360c5b25f0e7/FrenchFilter/sections/antiadblock.txt#L568) in fact. #### :arrow_right_hook: Have you noticed a difference with this rule at the beginning of the filter instead of at the end? :eyes:   ### :bulb: Suggestion idea (else …)
View it …   Although with the same conditions used (and tested _before_ your commit) I can't seem to reproduce this on my end (i.e. I have no anti-adblock message and video is playing fine), I suspect one thing _(regarding these cases: use of AdGuard Home / AdGuard DNS / Firefox with ETP enabled)_: My JS rule _(planned to be converted to scriptlet btw, now [this](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/e0ff057211c4569b0fafd77303ee360c5b25f0e7/FrenchFilter/sections/antiadblock.txt#L542) is fixed and most users have updated their AG installation)_ `tf1.fr#%#AG_defineProperty('__TF1_CONFIG__.adblock.serverRequest', { value: false, writable: false });` ¹ is _possibly_ sometimes not executed as quickly as required. Therefore, the request to `favicon.ico` is done and fails (because immediately blocked by the ETP protection regarding the Firefox case or because `0.0.0.0` returned for `static.adsafeprotected.com` for the DNS cases), consequently displaying an anti-adblock message. :arrow_right_hook: **Related / See also:** [uBlock Origin case](https://github.com/uBlockOrigin/uAssets/issues/14473) (which don't support _JS rules_). :arrow_right_hook: **Suggestion therefore:** Add `tf1.fr,tf1info.fr#%#//scriptlet('prevent-fetch', 'adsafeprotected')` ² just below [this line](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/e0ff057211c4569b0fafd77303ee360c5b25f0e7/FrenchFilter/sections/antiadblock.txt#L565). Thus, even in the case where the JS rule could not be applied quickly enough to signal the website not to make this request, it will be handled by this method.   ___ ###### ¹ Related to: `view-source:https://www.tf1.fr/` > `"adblock":{"checkUrl":"https://static.adsafeprotected.com/favicon.ico","display":false,"serverRequest":true}`. ###### ² They currently both use this URL, as can be seen by looking at: `__TF1_CONFIG__.adblock.checkUrl` (`tf1.fr`) and `__NEXT_DATA__.runtimeConfig.adBlock.serverUrl` (`tf1info.fr`) in console.

### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://www.themoviedb.org/](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.themoviedb.org%2F) ### Comment Username: @ifRemix > На роутере настроено, чтоб открывался > https://www.themoviedb.org > Обход блокировки tmdb настроен через DNS для их домена. > Но AdGuard блокирует сайт. > Отключаю AdGuard DNS (свой через quic и стандартный AdGuard) - сайт открывается, включаю - не открывается. > С нефильтрующим AdGuard работает. но нефильтрующий не нужен. > Или, может, запись какую надо сделать - в исключение как-то добавить? > Добавление в белый список не помогает. Отключение всех фильтров - не помогает. (по очереди отключались все) сайт открывается только если отключить полностью фильтрацию DNS. > Помогите, плз. ### Screenshots

comment.body: Ok, i still have this issue on my end unfortunately (without the advanced protection using the free version). I know having DNS enabled is kind of conflicts and brakes the adblocking in some cases. Try with ONLY enabling the Adguard DNS default nothing else and than try with your regular filters enabled and DNS too. DNS breaks the anti adblocking or the site detects DNS adblocking ?! i don't know really but definitely enabling DNS causing issues.

### Внимание

Эта проблема решается с помощью расширения [AdGuard Extra](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdGuardExtra).

Если вы используете AdGuard для Windows, Mac или Android, пожалуйста, убедитесь, что AdGuard Extra включен в настройках программы.

Если вы используете браузерное расширение AdGuard, мы рекомендуем установить AdGuard Extra в дополнение к нему.

pull_request.title: Maintenance related to KO website 4
pull_request.body:
## Prerequisites

### To avoid invalid pull requests, please check and confirm following terms

- [X] This is not an ad/bug report;
- [X] My code follows the [guidelines](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) and [syntax](https://kb.adguard.com/general/how-to-create-your-own-ad-filters) of this project;
- [X] I have performed a self-review of my own changes;
- [X] My changes do not break web sites, apps and files structure.

## What problem does the pull request fix?

### If the problem does not fall under any category that is listed here, please write a comment below in corresponding section

- [ ] Missed ads or ad leftovers;
- [ ] Website or app doesn't work properly;
- [ ] AdGuard gets detected on a website;
- [ ] Missed analytics or tracker;
- [ ] Social media buttons — share, like, tweet, etc;
- [ ] Annoyances — pop-ups, cookie warnings, etc;
- [X] Filters maintenance.

## What issue is being fixed?

### Enter the issue address

 - https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/95441
 - https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/93133
 - https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/pull/92116
 - https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/91955
 - https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/pull/91385
 - https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/pull/91173
 - https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/pull/91114
 - https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/pull/90955

### Add your comment and screenshots

 - https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/95441 - Resolved by https://github.com/List-KR/List-KR/commit/05fa8155405eee99751a331f071db65f8ca024b8.
 - https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/93133 - Resolved by List-KR.
 - https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/pull/92116 - Cannot find the element.
 - https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/91955 - Cannot find the element and request[^1]. Also resolved by List-KR[^2].
 - https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/pull/91385 - Low visitors[^3].
 - https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/pull/91173 - Low visitors[^4].
 - https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/pull/91114 - Cannot find the element. Also resolved by List-KR[^5].
 - https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/pull/90955 - Low visitors.

[^1]: https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/pull/133810/commits/3738cc076da07e7e38f10db741420e21aff7ae68
[^2]: https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/pull/133810/commits/ae930ec2c60ac4c6b8ac4bb597f612098086493e and https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/pull/133810/commits/f6eb1f836d4153724b15db43de5d8959b714099c
[^3]: https://www.similarweb.com/website/zoominlife.com/#traffic
[^4]: https://www.similarweb.com/website/janndk.com/#traffic
[^5]: https://github.com/List-KR/List-KR/commit/cfe081f982fba64da58bef644930b385e37755e7

### Terms

comment.body:
In this case `Advanced protection` is required to fix adblock detection with DNS filtering enabled.
 DNS blocking is simple and it's impossible to add rules for specific domains, we would need to unblock `pagead2.googlesyndication.com` for every website, but it's used on many websites, so we cannot do this.

### ATTENTION

This issue is known to be solved with [AdGuard Extra](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdGuardExtra) userscript.

If you're using AdGuard for Windows, Mac or Android, please make sure that AdGuard Extra is enabled in the application settings.

If you're using AdGuard Browser Extension, we suggest installing AdGuard Extra in addition to it.

* [Install for Chrome, Edge or other Chromium-based browsers](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_chrome_release)
* [Install for Firefox](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_firefox_release)
